On February 12, 2025, Erovoutika, in partnership with Food for the Hungry Philippines, introduced high school students at Basud National High School to the world of Robotics and Automation which featured activities like breadboarding and line-following robot training.
A mini competition was also organized to determine the fastest robot to complete the course in one lap. Students were eager to showcase their skills and innovation in this exciting and educational event.
A huge thanks to Food for the Hungry Philippines, the Black & Veatch Foundation Philippines, and the DOST-Technology Application and Promotion Institute for their invaluable support in making this initiative a reality.
We also extend our gratitude to Basud National High School for their warm hospitality.

title: FREESTYLE Category
content:
MGA UNIBERSIDAD, MAGPAPAKITANG-GILAS SA MURATA'S 2ND ROBOTICS COMPETITION
Matinding laban ng talino at technology ang masasaksihan ngayong araw sa Driving Technological Advancement: Murata's 2nd Robotics Competition, kung saan magtatagisan ng galing ang ilan sa pinakamahusay na unibersidad sa bansa sa larangan ng robotics ngayong Lunes, Marso 10, sa First Philippine Industrial Park (FPIP), Brgy. Pantay Bata, Tanauan City, Batangas.
Ang kumpetisyon ngayong taon ay may Free Style Competition, kung saan ipapakita ng mga kalahok ang kanilang innovative design at estratehikong maneuver gamit ang makabagong teknolohiya.
Kabilang sa mga kalahok ang Adamson University, Mapua University, Polytechnic University of the Philippines - Santa Rosa Campus, Technological University of the Philippines - Manila, De La Salle Lipa, at Batangas State University, The National Engineering University.
Ang itatanghal na Champion ay mag-uuwi ng Medalya, tropeo, at P50,000; First Runner-up â€“ P30,000 at Medalya; Second Runner-up â€“ P20,000 at Medalya.
Dinaluhan ang event ng mga kinatawan mula sa DOST-TAPI, PEZA, Erovoutika, Philippine Manufacturing Co. of Murata, Inc., at FPIP, na sumusuporta sa patuloy na pag-usbong ng teknolohiyang pang-inhinyeriya sa bansa.
Ayon sa Murata, ang kompetisyong ito ay bahagi ng kanilang misyon na paigtingin ang kultura ng pagkamalikhain at kahusayan sa larangan ng robotics at engineering. | JMP, BChannel NEWS
author: ERovoutika Electronics Robotics Automation

title: Congratulations to all the winners!
content:
Congratulations to all the winners!
EXCLUSIVE | Various universities across the country showcased their cutting-edge projects at Murataâ€™s 2nd Robotics Competition held on March 10 at FPIP, Brgy. Pantay Bata, Tanauan City, Batangas.
In the Free Style Competition, De La Salle Lipa emerged as the champion with their project "Voice Gest," a voice recognition system designed for the hearing-impaired.
TUP-Manila secured the 1st runner-up spot with "Rise of Agentic AI Robots," while BatStateU-TNEU was named 2nd runner-up for "Project DAHAN," an automated heart-rate assessment system for drivers.
BatStateU-TNEU was also recognized as the People's Choice Awardee, while other participants, including Adamson University, MapÃºa University, and PUP-Sta. Rosa, received consolation prizes.
The event was attended by representatives from DOST-TAPI, PEZA, Erovoutika, and Philippine Manufacturing Co. of Murata, Inc., with a panel of industry experts serving as judges. | JMPamintuan, BChannel NEWS

title: Murata Robolution: Robotics & Automation Competition 2025
content:
Murata Robolution: Robotics & Automation Competition 2025 is now happening Philippine Manufacturing Co. of Murata, Inc.
MGA HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS SA BANSA, MAGPAPAKITANG-GILAS SA MURATA'S EROVOUTHON 2.0 COMPETITION
Isang matinding laban ng talino at teknolohiya mula sa mga Junior High School students ang masasaksihan ngayong araw sa Murata's Erovouthon 2.0 Competition, ngayong Biyernes, Marso 14, sa Philippine Manufacturing Co. of Murata, Inc., First Philippine Industrial Park (FPIP), Brgy. Pantay Bata, Tanauan City, Batangas.
Ang bawat kalahok ay magpapakita ng kanilang proyekto o imbensyon na may positibong epekto sa kapaligiran at komunidad, gamit ang mga teknolohiyang tulad ng Bluetooth, Wi-Fi, GSM, iba pang wireless controls, camera image processing, at computer vision. Ang criteria for judging ay binubuo ng Electronics Management na may 20%; Innovativeness na may 30%; Creativity na may 30% at Relevance na may 20%.
Kabilang sa mga kalahok ang Santa Rosa Science and Technology High School, Calamba City Science Integrated School, De La Salle University â€“ DasmariÃ±as High School, Batangas City Integrated High School, Lipa City Science Integrated High School, at San Pablo City Science Integrated High School.
Ang Champion ay mag-uuwi ng medalya, tropeo, at P50,000; ang First Runner-up ay makakatanggap ng P35,000 at medalya; at ang Second Runner-up ay tatanggap ng P25,000 at medalya. Magkakaroon din ng Consolation Prize na P10,000 para sa mga hindi mapapabilang sa Top 3.
Dinaluhan ang event ng mga kinatawan mula sa DOST-TAPI, Erovoutika, at Philippine Manufacturing Co. of Murata, Inc., na patuloy na sumusuporta sa pag-unlad ng teknolohiyang pang-inhinyeriya sa bansa.
Ayon sa Murata, ang kompetisyong ito ay bahagi ng kanilang misyon na pausbongin at paigtingin ang kultura ng pagkamalikhain at kahusayan sa larangan ng robotics at engineering.| BChannel NEWS

ğ“ğğšğ¦ ğğ¡'ğ¬ ğ¬ğ¢ğ›ğ¥ğ¢ğ§ğ  ğğ®ğ¨ ğ›ğšğ ğ¬ ğ¦ğ®ğ¥ğ­ğ¢ğ©ğ¥ğ ğšğ°ğšğ«ğğ¬ ğ¢ğ§ ğ­ğ¡ğ ğ…ğ¢ğ›ğ¨ğ§ğšğœğœğ¢ ğˆğ§ğ­ğğ«ğ§ğšğ­ğ¢ğ¨ğ§ğšğ¥ ğ‘ğ¨ğ›ğ¨ğ­ ğšğ§ğ ğŒğšğ­ğ¡ ğğ¥ğ²ğ¦ğ©ğ¢ğšğ ğ‚ğ¨ğ¦ğ©ğğ­ğ¢ğ­ğ¢ğ¨ğ§
Louise Viviene P. Manila, a Grade 6 student, and her sister Lana Venice P. Manila, a Grade 8 student, currently enrolled in Robotics and Mathematics Program of Erovoutika International Academy, and from FAITH Catholic School, stood out among over 2,000 participants from 18 countries after bringing home multiple awards in the recently concluded Fibonacci EuroAsia Robot Olympiad and the Fibonacci International Mathematics Olympiad, held on April 16 to 24, 2025, in Antalya, Turkey.
At the Fibonacci EuroAsia Robot Olympiad, from April 16-20, 2025, under the mentorship of ERovoutika Electronics Robotics Automation coaches, Louise Viviene placed 3rd in the Drone Rally Competition. The duo also secured three more awards, including the Jury Award for Autonomous Drone Programming and Fast Line Following, and a Special Jury Award for the Mini Sumobot.
Adding to the family's streak of excellence, Lana Venice also competed in the Fibonacci International Mathematics Olympiad from April 20 to 24 under the guidance of Erovoutika team Among over 200 participants, she earned 3rd Place under Category 3 (Grades 7-8).
Their achievements qualified them to participate in the Education and Exchange Program in Italy and Turkey and to represent the Philippines at the Fibonacci International Robot Olympiad Global Finals, set to be held in Italy in November, bringing together the worldâ€™s best in robotics, innovation, and engineering.
The sisters were trained by Erovoutika Robotics and Automation Solutions, a leading provider of robotics and automation solutions dedicated to nurturing future innovators in robotics and STEM education.
The Fibonacci International Olympiad is one of the worldâ€™s most prestigious competitions, with a mission that directs young minds toward endless discoveries in mathematics and science. It brings together robotics and mathematics enthusiasts from around the world as an expo and educational platform, offering opportunities to engage with leading experts, explore cutting-edge technologies, and develop new collaborations.
